skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic brand colors and typography to create on-brand styling artifacts
skill.author: 7Spade

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill generates brand-compliant CSS and styling text output through LLM prompting. No actual network calls, file system modifications, or external command execution occur. The detected patterns are markdown documentation (hex color codes misinterpreted as shell syntax, license URLs as network indicators). This is a read-only branding utility that only produces text output.

content.value_statement: Teams creating presentations, documents, or design artifacts need consistent brand visuals. This skill provides Anthropic's official colors, typography, and styling guidelines for creating on-brand content.
actual_capabilities: Applies Anthropic brand color palette to styling artifacts
Provides official hex color codes for primary, secondary, and accent colors
Applies Poppins font to headings and Lora font to body text
Generates CSS and presentation styling based on brand guidelines
Includes fallback fonts for environments without custom fonts installed
limitations: Only generates text-based styling output, does not modify files directly
Requires user to apply the generated styling to their actual artifacts
Does not install fonts or modify system settings
Limited to Anthropic brand guidelines, does not support custom color schemes

use_cases.title: Create brand-compliant presentations
use_cases.description: Generate consistent color and font styling for slide decks, pitch decks, or corporate presentations using official Anthropic colors and typography.

use_cases.title: Style design mockups
use_cases.description: Apply Anthropic brand colors to wireframes, mockups, or design prototypes to maintain visual consistency with company standards.

use_cases.title: Write on-brand documentation
use_cases.description: Create documentation, internal guides, or technical docs that follow Anthropic's visual identity with correct fonts and color scheme.

prompt_templates.title: Basic brand styling request
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand guidelines to create styling for my artifact. Use the official brand colors: Dark (#141413) for primary text, Light (#faf9f5) for backgrounds, and accent colors Orange (#d97757), Blue (#6a9bcc), and Green (#788c5d). Apply Poppins font to headings and Lora font to body text.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need simple brand-compliant styling for a presentation or document

prompt_templates.title: Create CSS with brand colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate CSS code using Anthropic's official brand colors. Primary colors: Dark #141413, Light #faf9f5, Mid Gray #b0aea5, Light Gray #e8e6dc. Accent colors: Orange #d97757, Blue #6a9bcc, Green #788c5d. Include proper font declarations with Poppins for headings and Lora for body text, with Arial and Georgia fallbacks.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need CSS styling for web or digital artifacts

prompt_templates.title: Design a slide deck theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slide deck theme based on Anthropic brand guidelines. Include: title slide styling with Poppins font and dark background (#141413) with light text (#faf9f5), content slide layouts with accent color highlights, and consistent typography hierarchy. Specify hex color codes and font treatments for each element.
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating a presentation using Anthropic's visual identity

prompt_templates.title: Full brand specification document
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive brand specification document that includes: complete color palette with hex, RGB, and CMYK values, typography system with font weights and sizing, usage guidelines for backgrounds versus text, and examples of correct and incorrect color combinations. Reference Anthropic's official brand guidelines.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a detailed reference document for brand compliance

output_examples.input: Apply Anthropic brand colors to style a heading and body text
output_examples.output:
**Heading Styling:**
- Font: Poppins (with Arial fallback)
- Size: 24pt or larger
- Color: #141413 (Dark) on light backgrounds, #faf9f5 (Light) on dark backgrounds
- Weight: Bold

**Body Text Styling:**
- Font: Lora (with Georgia fallback)
- Size: 12-14pt
- Color: #141413 (Dark)
- Line height: 1.5

**Accent Colors for Shapes and Graphics:**
- Primary accent: #d97757 (Orange)
- Secondary accent: #6a9bcc (Blue)
- Tertiary accent: #788c5d (Green)

output_examples.input: Generate CSS for an Anthropic-styled button component

best_practices: Always use the official hex color codes provided in the brand guidelines for accurate color matching.
Apply Poppins font to headings (24pt+) and Lora to body text to establish clear visual hierarchy.
Use accent colors (orange, blue, green) for non-text elements like buttons, icons, and decorative shapes.
Ensure sufficient contrast between text and background colors for accessibility compliance.
anti_patterns: Using non-brand colors for primary elements, which breaks visual consistency.
Applying body fonts to headings, which weakens the typography hierarchy.
Using accent colors for text, which reduces readability and violates brand guidelines.
Mixing brand fonts with unrelated font families that clash with the design system.

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The brand styling output can be applied in any design tool, presentation software, or web project.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files on my system?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates text-based styling guidance and code. It does not write files or modify your system. You apply the generated styling manually.

faq.question: What fonts does Anthropic use?
faq.answer: Anthropic uses Poppins for headings and Lora for body text. The skill includes Arial and Georgia as fallback fonts for environments where custom fonts are not available.

faq.question: Can I use these colors for commercial projects?
faq.answer: The brand guidelines provide colors for creating content that represents Anthropic. For commercial use, ensure your project has proper authorization to use Anthropic branding.

faq.question: What are the primary brand colors?
faq.answer: The primary palette includes Dark (#141413) for text and dark backgrounds, Light (#faf9f5) for light backgrounds, Mid Gray (#b0aea5) for secondary elements, and Light Gray (#e8e6dc) for subtle backgrounds.

faq.question: How do I apply these colors to presentations?
faq.answer: Use the hex codes in your presentation software's color picker. Apply Dark (#141413) text on Light (#faf9f5) backgrounds for maximum contrast, and use accent colors for shapes, icons, and decorative elements.
